required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Experience of Pain During Oocyte Retrieval- a Comparison Between Two Aspiration Needles
clinical_study.official_title: Experience of Pain During Oocyte Retrieval- a Comparison Between Two Aspiration Needles

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of the study is to compare the pain experience between the patients that have had their transvaginal oocytes retrieval with ultrasound guidance performed with reduced single lumen needle (Vitrolife Sweden AB, Gothenburg) with the patients that have had follicle aspiration needle, 1.4 outer diameter (Vitrolife Sweden AB, Gothenburg), during the procedure.

detailed_description.textblock: Although the patient is sedated and local analgesia has been given, transvaginal oocytes retrieval with ultrasound guidance can still cause a lot of pain, both during and after the procedure. To reduce the pain, some clinics prefer to use needles as thin as 0.8 mm (outer diameter, OD). A disadvantage with these needles is the increased aspiration time. Therefore a new needle has been developed that has the possibility to reduce pain without a large increase in aspiration time. The needle has a 50 mm long tip with an outer diameter of 0.9 mm. The remaining part of the needle is 300 mm long with an outer diameter of 1.4 mm.

primary_outcome.time_frame: After the oocyte retrieval and before the patient leaves the operation room e.g. within a maximum of 30 minutes.
primary_outcome.description: Rating of pain was performed by self-assessment by means of Visual Analogue Scale (VAS) consisting of a line oriented vertically on a paper with a range from 0 mm (no pain) to 100 mm (unbearable pain).

secondary_outcome.time_frame: During and directly after oocyte retrieval
secondary_outcome.description: Vaginal bleeding during or after the procedure was graded subjectively by the physician as (i) less than normal, (ii) normal or (iii) more than normal.

arm_group.description: Transvaginal oocyte retrieval was performed under local anaesthesia and under guidance of ultrasound with the RN needle that had an outer diameter of 0.9 mm (20 gauge) and inner diameter of 0.6 mm for the last 50 mm from the tip of the needle and an outer diameter of 1.4 mm (17 gauge) and inner diameter of 1 mm for the remaining length of the needle. The puncture procedure was performed according to each clinic's standard routine. Aspiration pressure was kept at a negative pressure between 90 and 120 mmHg.

Transvaginal oocyte retrieval was performed under local anaesthesia and under guidance of ultrasound with the SN needle that had an outer diameter of 1.4 mm (17 gauge) and inner diameter of 1 mm for the remaining length of the needle. or the SN with an outer diameter of 1.4 mm (17 gauge) and inner diameter of 1 mm for the whole length of the needle. The puncture procedure was performed according to each clinic's standard routine. Aspiration pressure was kept at a negative pressure between 90 and 120 mmHg.

intervention.intervention_name: Swemed Follicle Aspiration Set Reduced Single Lumen
intervention.description: Thin tip to penetrate the tissue

intervention.intervention_name: Swemed Follicle Aspiration Set Single Lumen (1.4 mm)
intervention.description: Standard (1.4 mm) needle to penetrate the tissue

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- The patient has signed an informed consent form before the oocyte retrieval
- The patient is undergoing oocyte retrieval with local anaesthesia
- The patient can speak and understand Swedish
Exclusion Criteria:
- The patient has previously participated in Vitrolife-needle-01 study
- The patient has a body mass index ≥35
- Other contra indicator for oocyte retrieval

group.description: Swemed Follicle Aspiration Set Reduced Single Lumen: Thin tip to penetrate the tissue

group.title: Standard Follicle Aspiration Needle

measure.title: Race and Ethnicity Not Collected
measure.population: Race and Ethnicity were not collected from any participant.

outcome.title: Visual Analogue Scale
outcome.description: Rating of pain was performed by self-assessment by means of Visual Analogue Scale (VAS) consisting of a line oriented vertically on a paper with a range from 0 mm (no pain) to 100 mm (unbearable pain).
outcome.time_frame: After the oocyte retrieval and before the patient leaves the operation room e.g. within a maximum of 30 minutes.

group.title: Thin Follicle Aspiration Needle
group.description: Swemed Follicle Aspiration Set Reduced Single Lumen: Thin tip to penetrate the tissue

group.title: Standard Follicle Aspiration Needle
group.description: Swemed Follicle Aspiration Set Single Lumen (1.4 mm): Standard (1.4 mm) needle to penetrate the tissue

measure.title: Visual Analogue Scale
measure.description: Rating of pain was performed by self-assessment by means of Visual Analogue Scale (VAS) consisting of a line oriented vertically on a paper with a range from 0 mm (no pain) to 100 mm (unbearable pain).

analysis.groups_desc: The primary end-point was the 'overall pain experience', evaluated as described previously. Assuming the mean overall pain in the RN group to be 27 mm (value chosen after analysis of data from a previous study, Cerne et al., 2006) on VAS, with a standard deviation (SD) of 21.5 mm, 121 patients in each group would be needed to demonstrate a decrease in overall pain of 8 mm (30%) with 80% power and a significance level of 0.05 (two-tailed tests).

outcome.title: Intervention Because of Bleeding
outcome.description: Vaginal bleeding during or after the procedure was graded subjectively by the physician as (i) less than normal, (ii) normal or (iii) more than normal.
outcome.time_frame: During and directly after oocyte retrieval
outcome.population: Bleeding during follicle aspiration was graded in all patients included in the study.

group.title: Thin Follicle Aspiration Needle
group.description: Transvaginal oocyte retrieval was performed under local anaesthesia and under guidance of ultrasound with the RN needle that had an outer diameter of 0.9 mm (20 gauge) and inner diameter of 0.6 mm for the last 50 mm from the tip of the needle and an outer diameter of 1.4 mm (17 gauge) and inner diameter of 1 mm for the remaining length of the needle. The puncture procedure was performed according to each clinic's standard routine. Aspiration pressure was kept at a negative pressure between 90 and 120 mmHg. Swemed Follicle Aspiration Set Reduced Single Lumen: Thin tip to penetrate the tissue

group.description: Transvaginal oocyte retrieval was performed under local anaesthesia and under guidance of ultrasound with the SN needle that had an outer diameter of 1.4 mm (17 gauge) and inner diameter of 1 mm for the remaining length of the needle. or the SN with an outer diameter of 1.4 mm (17 gauge) and inner diameter of 1 mm for the whole length of the needle. The puncture procedure was performed according to each clinic's standard routine. Aspiration pressure was kept at a negative pressure between 90 and 120 mmHg. Swemed Follicle Aspiration Set Single Lumen (1.4 mm): Standard (1.4 mm) needle to penetrate the tissue

measure.population: Bleeding during follicle aspiration was graded in all patients included in the study.

reported_events.time_frame: Records of serious events were collected over a period of one week after oocyte pick-up (OPU)

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: There is NOT an agreement between Principal Investigators and the Sponsor (or its agents) that restricts the PI's rights to discuss or publish trial results after the trial is completed.
